sensortoolkit.plotting._scatter.draw_scatterÔÉÅ

draw_scatter(ax, xdata, ydata, param_dict, sensor_stats=None, xlims=None, ylims=None, fontsize=None, detail_fontsize=None, param=None, plot_regression=True, colormap_vals=None, colormap_name=None, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

A helper function to draw scatterplots with linear regressions on passed matplotlib axes instance

Parameters

  • ax (Matplotlib axes instance) ‚Äì The axes object on which the scatter plot is drawn

  • xdata (numpy array or pandas Series) ‚Äì The x data (reference data)

  • ydata (numpy array or pandas Series) ‚Äì The y data (sensor data)

  • param_dict (dict) ‚Äì Dictionary of kwargs to pass to ax.plot

  • sensor_stats (pandas DataFrame) ‚Äì Dataframe contain regression statistics for single sensor (subset of the full stats_df object)

  • xlims (tuple) ‚Äì The domain of the graph

  • ylims (tuple) ‚Äì The range of the graph

  • fontsize (int) ‚Äì Selects the fontsize of regression statistics

  • detail_fontsize (int or float) ‚Äì Fontsize for axes tick labels and smaller plotting text elements.

  • param (str) ‚Äì The name of the parameter for which measurements will be plotted.

  • plot_regression (bool) ‚Äì True plots linear regression, regression equation, R^2, and RMSE

  • colormap_vals (Dataframe column or none) ‚Äì Data that are used to set the colormap value.

  • colormap_name (string or none) ‚Äì The name of the colormap which the scatter plot will be assigned The name of the Matplotlib colormap that will be used when superimposing scatter points with RH values. A full list of colormaps is can be found in the Matplotlib documentation

Keyword Arguments:

Parameters

  • monocolor (str) ‚Äì A single color (specified in hex) for scatter. Scatter are colored using monocolor if colormap_vals is empty. Defaults to ‚Äò#0048AD‚Äô.

  • point_size (float) ‚Äì The size of the scatter points. Defaults to 20.

  • point_alpha (float) ‚Äì The transparency of the scatter plots. Defaults to 0.7.

  • plot_aspect (str) ‚Äì Aspect ratio for scatter plot dimensions. Defaults to ‚Äòequal‚Äô.

  • plottext_alpha (float) ‚Äì The transparency of the text drawn on scatter plots indicating regression statistics. Defaults to 0.8.

  • plottext_size (float) ‚Äì The size of the text drawn on scatter plots indicating regression statistics as a fraction of the passed fontsize. Defaults to 90% the value of the fontsize.

  • plottext_color (str) ‚Äì The color of the text drawn on scatter plots indicating regression statistics. Defaults to ‚Äòk‚Äô.

  • plottext_xloc (float) ‚Äì The left-most x-coordinate of the text drawn on scatter plots. Default depends on the value passed to the plottext_postion argument.

  • plottext_yloc (float) ‚Äì The top-most y-coordinate of the text drawn on scatter plots. Default depends on the value passed to the plottext_postion argument.

  • plottext_xdisplacement (float) ‚Äì The width displacement between text drawn on scatter plots. Defaults to 0.0.

  • plottext_ydisplacement (float) ‚Äì The height displacement between rows of text drawn on scatter plots. Defaults to 0.08.

  • plottext_position (str) ‚Äì Determines position of plot text. Options include ‚Äòupper_left‚Äô or ‚Äòbottom_right‚Äô. Defaults to ‚Äòupper_left‚Äô if the slope of the ‚Äò regression is greater than 1.75, else default is set to ‚Äòbottom_right‚Äô.

  • show_trendline (bool) ‚Äì If true, display the OLS trendline on scatter plots. Defaults to True.

  • show_RMSE (bool) ‚Äì If true, display the root mean squared error on scatter plots. Defaults to True.

  • show_spearman (bool) ‚Äì If true, display the spearman correlation on scatterplots. Defaults to False.

  • show_N (bool) ‚Äì If true, display the number of scatter point pairs displayed on the plot. Defaults to True.

  • show_one_to_one (bool) ‚Äì If true, display the one-to-one line indicating ideal agreement between independent and depdendent variable. Defaults to True.

  • trendline_xmax (float) ‚Äì The draw distance (based on the passed x-coordinate) of the OLS trendline. Defaults to 120% the maximum of the independent variable.

  • trendline_color (str) ‚Äì The color of the trendline. Defaults to ‚Äòk‚Äô (black).

  • trendline_alpha (float) ‚Äì The transparency of the trendline. Defaults to 0.65.

Returns

Matplotlib axes instance with scatter drawn along with additional elements specified in the kwargs (text, colormap)

Return type

plotobj
